text: No, darling, lip rouge--all over your mouth.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I like touching you--poison ivy.  You'd just been kissing that girl when I came in, hadn't you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

And when you do I'll convey your respects by wireless to Herbert.  Take it easy, Lee--no other woman'll ever get you. At least I'm honest when I tell you there must be something pretty low down in me--because I like you.  You're such a swine!",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
--and I can tell you where to get off.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I didn't ask you to come away with me--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Just make it as difficult as possible for you to see her.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You mind your own business! She's an old friend of mine and I like her--what're you going to do about it?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Did you muss up her hair by accident, too?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't talk such bunk! She's one of the acts on the ship. I just ran into her by accident.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't look so uncomfortable, Lee--it interferes with your good looks. Give me a cigarette.  What did you do--persuade her to come on this voyage with you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sure! You're never at a loss for words.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
So that's your little dancer that you were playing around with in New York.  Oh--there's no accounting for tastes--  Mine, too, seem to be in the gutter.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And <U>do</U> bring Miss Marsh--  --when she's had time to tidy up a bit.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well--shall we go into dinner?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes--I met Miss Marsh. In fact, she always seems to be turning up in the most unusual circumstances.  What's the matter, Miss Marsh--aren't you feeling well?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm sorry, but you three men can play poker or something.  Shall I see you tomorrow?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
But, Anya, dear! Unless you play we won't have a fourth.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That's fine--because you're going to see a lot of me ... for the rest of your life.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't be crazy--I'm tickled to death to see you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Here's to Europe!  Couldn't try to look a little less glum, could you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

When I found out you were going I just had an attack of nerves--a few tears--and Herbert was on his way downtown to get my passport ... so who cares ... I'm here with you ... and that's all that matters to me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
How'd you ever get away with it?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're a charming liar. You <U>know</U>, Herbert's too dull to be suspicious about anything--even when I suddenly decided to come to Europe at a few hours' notice--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I had an idea your husband was getting suspicious.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It would be a nice change from you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Then why the sudden exit without even telling me?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I wasn't running out on you. When I got over there-- made my plans--I'd have sent for you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Any woman's crazy to feel about a man the way I do about you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't you hate people that surprise you? ... I do.  We can't stand here.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why worry? It was insured--how about that swimming lesson I promised you?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No--I'm furious!--Nobody seems to do anything about it--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We'll save you a place at our table.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Will you please excuse me? I'll be right back.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sooner--if you like.  See you again, I hope.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thanks. I'll be there. About seven-thirty?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes, yes--the air--  --I'm getting plenty of air.  Miss Marsh--Mrs. Rosson.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Feeling a little better, I see.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm just commencing to enjoy this trip.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I can think of nothing nicer. It's very kind of you to invite me--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

You were indiscreet enough to leave your gloves in my apartment one evening--  --and he was gentleman enough to boast <U>why</U> you'd been there and show me a snapshot of you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sorry I can't return the compliment.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're Anya Rosson, aren't you? I've heard of you back in New York.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thanks, no. I despise any form of exercise.  Don't forget we have an engagement for cocktails and cards.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
How do you do. Would you care to finish the game? I have a slight earache.  --and it's so noisy up here.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm going down to my cabin. I have to send a wireless-- see you later.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're lucky--out my way, in Montana, there's nothing else to do--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well, it'll have to be poker--but I'm so unlucky in that game.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
--that's what we call double-a grade lumber, ma'am; You don't find a knot in a thousand feet.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Lumber, ma'am--spent all my life out there piling up a bank balance--  --and now gosh darn it--""Honest Jack""--that's what they call me--is goin' to see the world.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

A rare pleasure to meet you, ma'am! Where I come from --out in Montana--we have some pretty women, but I guess if you walked down Main Street they'd turn out the fire brigade.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Is that why you killed Lee Lother?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Stick-up. Needed dough to get ashore.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Lifted it out of a guy's cabin last night.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I'll lay odds you get a pair of 'em--Why, a high-school kid could take you saps--and another thing--Lay off Sally Marsh.  --""Honest Jack""! One look at your mug and the whole world buttons up its pockets.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And I'll lay odds you got that bracelet.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm making it to you. If I don't get it by tonight--you'll find it a <U>rough</U> voyage.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, no--I played with <U>your</U> cards--in <U>your</U> cabin--at <U>your</U> suggestion--If you've got a kick coming, make it to the Purser.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
In that case--you owe us exactly sixteen hundred dollars.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I agree with you--no gentleman, would--But I would--  --especially when my opponents have taken the precaution of marking the cards.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No gentleman would do that.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
How about a little game later?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That depends on how mother's feeling. You'll excuse me, gentlemen?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And me coming in with two pair-- ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll bet a couple of hundred.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I should pass, but I'll trail along--I'll take three. ",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
If I ever won a pot that large the boat would sink. ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well, I'm off to a pretty good start.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We haven't any chips, Mr. Brett--Do you mind playing with cash?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Hmm! So am I. If you'll excuse me I have some important unfinished business. I'll see you all later.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm going to return the bracelet right now and face the consequences.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Seven-fifty. Positively my last offer.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll change and be with you in ten minutes.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm beginning to think you're a pretty swell guy.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You can't lose me, Sally--I'm no lily myself!",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
He's a con man--crooked as a tree--and I was part of the racket--helped him!  Now--if you have an appointment elsewhere--I'll excuse you!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You can live that down, can't you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Too much--Remember--I warned you about me--  I used to be Lee Lother's girl--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What do you know about them?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That was the come-on--promise me you won't play with them again--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, you infant! How much did you lose?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A Mr. Summers and a man called Lother.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Just met her on the boat--supposed to play bridge with her yesterday--but she wouldn't--so we played poker instead.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, that's Mrs. Rosson--remember, you met her yesterday?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I could see you were pining away--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll give you plenty of rings as soon as I get the stones set--what do you think?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're a little ahead of yourself--the usual routine would be for you to propose, and if I accept, then you'd give me an engagement ring--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You didn't?--I guess I forgot to tell you--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I didn't <U>know</U> we were <U>going</U> to be married.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I think we'll live in Europe after we're married?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes--you know what I've been thinking, Sally?--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
This time I'm really glad you showed up.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes--is it all right if I come like this? ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Would you like to take a turn around the deck with me?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You said it! How about a little action?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Let's forget it--can't you see I kind of like you, too ... and I don't want to get involved.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
--I know what I'm talking about. I'm no high-school girl looking through a window--reaching for the moon.  Guess I'll be going.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Will you take some advice?  If you're looking for romance--count me out--  --if you know what's good for you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
For once I'm dead on the level--  --crazy about you!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't kid me. I'm in no mood for it.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You don't know anything about me. If you did, you probably wouldn't be here.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I can't blame the ocean--it's you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That's funny--so was I.  Guess the ocean makes one sentimental,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A lot of things I'd like to forget.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Decent?  I guess any guy could be decent--if you were interested.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Anything I can do?  I'd jump overboard if it'd help you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I must say you're persistent--  --it's kind of flattering.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're forgiven if you don't make dates with anybody except me for the rest of the voyage.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm sorry I'm late, but something happened.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
See you at seven-thirty in the lounge.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Wrong again--  But I dislike possessive women.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Fatal fascination of James Brett wins out.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
But I'll have cocktails with you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You asked me to dine with you tonight.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
--you want to adopt him!--Good for you!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A little boy that has escaped from his nurse and--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What a horrible death! Do you know what you remind me of?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I want you to get used to my voice--you're going to hear it a lot.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Nothing to speak of. What is this--third degree?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Keep your eyes on the ball, Mister.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You know, you're not a <U>bad</U>-looking girl. In fact--I think you're lovely.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Even Cupid's becoming modern, using medicine balls instead of darts.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't stop, nurse--I think I'm going to faint.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Aw--give a feller a break. My cards are on the table-- I want to know you. How about dining with me tonight?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You work too fast for me, young man.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, yes, I am, because <U>afterwards</U>--up here in the moonlight.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're not very ambitious, are you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
This is great. I'll be able to watch your act every night.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Have we?--Well, I'd just as soon play shuffle-board.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
--sorry--got an appointment to play shuffle-board.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Wait a minute!--They're dancing in the palm court--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
How about giving me another coat?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't thank me. Do you recognize me without the lipstick?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh--hello!  I got the flowers. That was sweet of you--thank you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Where have you been hiding?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No! Don't touch it! I want the <U>world</U> to see my <U>shame</U>.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
--You'll have all the boys tipping their hats to you--  --let me wipe it off.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You've got lipstick all over you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
She looks like a lot of other boats. I grant you she's beautiful. ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I wouldn't miss this boat for a million.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'd <U>like</U> to be.  Sailing on the <U>Progress?</U>,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I thought you were one of my friends.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why--I--er thought with all this heat turned on I'd hide it.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Listen, Runt--Quick! Where's the ice?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
See you later, Shortie--I'm off to the pool.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sure! McKinney will never suspect you--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sure--and to show you I'm a regular fella--  Here's that twenty-five hundred. ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, is she? What a shame!  You'll pardon me?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Your mother is feeling seasick and would like to see you right away.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sorry to interrupt you, Mr Brett, but I have a message for you.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thank you.  I owe you a dollar forty--here--keep the change.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Here's your twenty-five hundred, Mr. Brett.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Have the purser give you twenty-five hundred dollars for this check--and bring the cash here.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That's where you come in. Now, listen, Shortie--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well, if that's the case, you're sure of winning the first couple of hands--But what about after that?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
They won't squawk--they're professionals.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well, I had to get some dough to play with those suckers. Here, get this changed.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You take some awful chances.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Here--drop it where they'll find it and return it to him. He's not a bad egg. I'll ship him back the fifty before we arrive.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You know where that sense of humor's goin' to get you one of these days--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I fell in his arms--Couldn't resist it.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Right!--but it doesn't have to apply to you--Keep your eyes open for anybody wearing a lot of cracked ice and give me the office.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Pleasure first if it don't interfere with business.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A dollar forty--out of the two dollars I gave you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Just a minute, steward--haven't you forgotten something?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why <U>didn't</U> I think of that?--I am going to scout around and see if I can find her.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Maybe she's in the show--One of the troupers--did you ever think of that?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
She was wearing a white dress with a cute, black hat-- and carrying a bag with S. M. on it.  Funny--her name's not on the passenger list. ",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A thousand? She's one in a million--right off the top of the rosebush!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, Shortie!--  --there's a girl on this ship--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't let money spoil a beautiful friendship. Look at these here telegrams to be delivered! This ain't a job-- it's a marathon.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Is that a nice way to talk to a pal?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Until then--the dollar forty stays with me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Come on--  I'll promote a card game, and we'll be sitting pretty.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll need it--gave my last buck to the bedroom steward.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yeah--but high livin's made me soft.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Stop squawking! You were doing this job on a ship four years ago when I first picked you up, weren't you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yer lucky I'm here at all. I tell you, Jimmy--my feet'll never hold out.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Looks like he's taking a trip--see the baggage? The only time they ever picked me up, McKinney walked through the room while they were grilling--let's see how good his memory is.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, no--You're not gonna give my hard-earned money away.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Quick, let me have that money. I'm broke and I'll need it for tips.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
He's a colored man in chauffeur's uniform carrying a basket of fruit.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll give you half of it.  Here's seventy cents. ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No, you're not. Give me that dollar seventy.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A dollar seventy and I'm gonna keep it!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It'll never hurt you---Got any money?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh, I'm not squawkin', but I'm not used to working and it's a bad habit to get into.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

No bank roll there, boy.  Lucky I could get you signed on--they picked up that Pittsburgh jeweler--made him talk. The heat's on, Shortie--and those Atlantic breezes are going to be mighty welcome.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We coulda got two third-class!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We didn't have enough dough for two tickets, did we?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
If I was smart I wouldn't be working my way over on this ship. ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I thought you were a smart guy.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't you know better than to talk to me with people around?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Not here--follow me around the shed.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Make it three, boys--I'll play this hand pat.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I thought you were a sucker--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why isn't that a good time to quit?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why, you wouldn't quit when you're ahead, would you?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well, to tell you the truth, gentlemen, I've sworn off playing poker.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That beats two Pairs. I'm glad <U>I</U> didn't win the first pot. Take the money, Mr. Brett.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't worry about that.  We'll settle after the hand. Out in Montana where I come from a man's word is all that's necessary. What have you got?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll bet a couple of hundred--  I wonder what's keeping that boy.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Hope I didn't keep you waiting.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thanks. That makes us square.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Mmmmmmmmmhm....  Now, Jimmy, what were you doing in that corridor before the shots were fired?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You keep out of this--  You admit you thought of killing him--how were you going to do it?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't get yourself all worked up--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't be too smart, Jimmy--you're out in the rough yourself. You had an argument with Lother a couple of hours before he was killed--but I'll deal with that later--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thought you might need me--don't talk, kid, and don't let him scare you-- ",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Anybody that's taken the trouble to get it would be a mug to put it back.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Nice girl, that--  I'd hate to see <U>her</U> get a raw deal.  You know, the great trouble with crooks is they're <U>too</U> smart. Now if I'd taken that bracelet, I'd find some way to slip it back--I'd know I could never get ashore with it.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Wouldn't bet against her.  Tell you what I will do--bet you I find that bracelet before we hit France.  Not a hundred, though--just fifty.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Nooooo!--going to catch up on my reading.  I'll take this one.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Coming to the pool for a swim?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Then we run our hands down a man's arms and legs-- like this--in case they got what you're looking for attached to a string.  See what I mean, Purser?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

This has nothing to do with me--  But always remember, Purser, when you're searching anybody, take the lining of their coat, like this--  --run your fingers all along these seams.... Then-- back of the collar--<U>here</U>--that used to be a favorite trick--and never forget to put your finger down inside of the shoe--like this.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
How about trying your fine Italian hand?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It's easy to see the Purser hasn't had much practice.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Well, someone else besides myself may have seen you in the vicinity of Mrs. Rosson's cabin this evening--even the stewards in that corridor insisted on being searched. Get me?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You know what I'd do, if I were you--before the card game I'd go to the Purser's office.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No, thanks. I've promised to play cards.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Nervous. Couldn't sleep. Feel like a nightcap? ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thought you were going to turn in, Inspector.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No, thanks--I'll take a walk around the deck and then turn in--",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I wouldn't worry about it--it'll turn up--  How about a nightcap, Inspector?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
If he lets you down I'll try my hand at sleuthing--  Bet I could find that bracelet--,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
